summary: This document is an email chain from January 2021 involving Jordy Feldman, the Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program, attempting to contact law enforcement officials (a Special Agent and a Detective) to discuss the program and request information for evaluating victim claims. It highlights the program's operation as a litigation-alternative and its need for coordination with ongoing investigations.

persons.name: Jordy Feldman
persons.role: Administrator of the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program
persons.context: The sender of the emails, initiating contact with law enforcement to discuss the compensation program for Epstein's victims and request information for claim assessment.

persons.name: Elena Voumas
persons.context: Copied on the initial email from Jordy Feldman to Special Agent M, suggesting she is a colleague or involved party.

persons.name: Special Agent M
persons.context: The primary recipient of Jordy Feldman's follow-up email; a law enforcement official involved in the Epstein investigation whom Feldman is trying to contact for information.

connections.description: Feldman, as the administrator of the victim compensation program, is attempting to contact Special Agent M to discuss the program and request general information about the investigation process.
Feldman was referred to Special Agent M by the Detective, indicating the Detective is a point of contact within law enforcement for the compensation program.
The Detective refers Feldman to Special Agent M, indicating they are part of a coordinated law enforcement effort (NYPD and FBI) on the Epstein case.

events.title: Initial Outreach to Law Enforcement
events.description: Jordy Feldman sends initial emails to a Detective and Special Agent M, introducing the Epstein Victims' Compensation Program and requesting a meeting.

events.title: Establishment of Epstein Victims' Compensation Program
events.description: The independent Epstein Victims' Compensation Program was established as a litigation-alternative to resolve claims of Jeffrey Epstein's victims.

locations: NYPD Detective Bureau Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force
keyFacts: Jordy Feldman served as the Administrator of the independent Epstein Victims' Compensation Program (VCP) established in 2020.
The VCP was created as a litigation-alternative to resolve financial claims from victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
The program administrator was actively seeking coordination and information from law enforcement (FBI and NYPD) involved in the ongoing Epstein investigation to aid in claim evaluation.
The email chain demonstrates operational communication between the victim compensation program and law enforcement agencies in early 2021.
